answers.author: Iris Jessie
answers.text:
We ask people to give us their email addresses when we have events such as festivals, concerts, town hall meetings, etc.  We have developed a very nice directory that can be used to publicize future events.  We have someone go through the crowd and ask people to provide their info.

answers.author: Mike Cohen
answers.text:
One effective way to build your email list, increase attendance at public meetings, as well as augment and diversify feedback in your decision making processes, is to regularly post online public comment forums on topics that are highly relevant to your community. 
Each time that you post an online topic, it will attract more people -- who provide their email address in order to post their comments, and they will also forward the online forum to other people in the community. 
Overtime, you will build your email list, create more awareness of topics (and their corresponding public meetings), as well as ultimately augment and diversify the people that participate.
For online public comment forums that are civil, legal, insightful and cost-effective here are two recent examples of what AFI members are doing:
Salt Lake City: http://www.slcgov.com/OpenCityHall
Lake Oswego OR: http://www.ci.oswego.or.us/council/OpenCityHall.htm

answers.author: Carmine Scavo
answers.text:
To increase attendance, consider the following:
1. Where are your meetings held? Oftentimes, downtown (city hall) meetings are inconvenient for people--parking, travel, etc. Move meetings around the city
2. When are your meetings being held? Day of week (Weds in many places in the country is a church night). Time of day (evenings are sometimes bad--try late afternoon or midday instead)
3. Food is always a good idea (refreshments will be served)

author: Ashley Greiber
text: Currently the municipality that I work for promotes their meetings for the general public with signs, newspaper articles, and blog postings.  These don't seem to be drawing people in.  What other ways are successful??? What is the easiest way to collect email addresses from the public to send them information?
title: Municipal Event Marketing
